text:
October 12, 1956
Mr. Ray Slavin
Station Manager WALI
Adelphi College
Garden City, New York
Dear Mr* Slavin:
In answer to your letter of October 6, we would like to give you informa¬
tion regarding membership in the National Association of Educational Broad¬
casters*
The NAEB has three categories of membership, as follows*
Active — Educational institutions, public service organiza¬
tions, etc. owning and operating their own radio
and/or television stations*
Associate - Institutions (as above) not owning stations, but
operating production centers and regularly pro¬
ducing programs over a commercial outlet.
Affiliate — Any organization or individual interested in the
general furtherance of educational broadcasting.
For active members with radio stations, dues in the association are based on
rated transmitter power, as follows:
Class A - 5 kw and over - $50.00
Class B - 1 - 4*9 kw - 25.00
Class C - less than 1 kw - 15.00
Television stations with less than 5kw video power pay $50.00 and those with
5 kw or more video power pay $100.00
Associate and Affiliate members pay $10.00 a year. For this fee members re¬
ceive our monthly Newsletter: the various reports and surveys we piblish
periodically; services of our Placement Service, television engineer, legal
counsel, management consultant, etc.; plus the normal day to day services,
information, and advice that any national organization gives its members.
